name: Thank You
pages:
Dear colleague,

The time has finally come for me to depart, and I want to take this opportunity to thank you infinitely one last time. As I've mentioned before, I intend to take this discovery around the lands, and I will try to save

as many people as possible from the plague.

It will take decades before we manage to spread the news of the cure, but what matters now is that we know that undeath can be cured, and that alone will be enough to give hope to the new generation.

Of course, I will never stop researching, of course not! The spirit of adventure runs in our blood after all, and despite my age, I feel reborn at this moment! Will it be just a passing phase? Who knows, but if there's one thing you've taught me, it's

that one must never give up, and so I shall not.

To conclude, there's one last thing I want to leave you: an ancient decorated horn that I found years ago during one of my wanderings. I never understood what its original purpose was, but it has a

very energetic sound, and I have often enjoyed playing it to announce my arrival in dangerous and mysterious places.

For all this time, I have made you pay for the information behind my discoveries, but since you saved my life, I believe this is the perfect gift

for a fellow researcher like you.

Well, that's all. I hope you like my gift and that you will remember me, because I will certainly remember you.
I am finally about to depart not for an end, but for a new beginning, and with the last

drop of ink I have left, I wish you good research and good continuation!

May your light be a beacon for the future of Growsseth!
